content.question: Which of the following is true for a perfectly competitive, decreasing-cost industry?

choices.label: The price of inputs will decrease as the number of firms in the industry decreases.
The long-run market supply curve will be downward sloping.
Firms earn positive economic profit in the long run.
Firms do not have a shutdown condition.
There are no economies of scale.

content.answer: The long-run market supply curve will be downward sloping.
